Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bac2A K7 (Bac2A analog, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution,  animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (91.67%) toBac2AR: 33%; V=I=A: 25%.Activity: active against P. aeruginosa H103 (MIC 31 uM), E. coli (MIC 16 uM), S. enterica ssp. Typhimurium or S. Typhimurium (MIC 63 uM). S.aureus ATCC25923 (MIC 125 uM), S. epidermidis clinical strain (MIC 31 uM), E.faecalis ATCC29212 (MIC 125 uM), and C. albicans (MIC 31 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Hilpert K, Volkmer-Engert R, Walter T, Hancock RE.2005
Literature Information.Title: High-throughput generation of small antibacterial peptides with improved activity
